author: {'steamid': '76561198136142958', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1525731646}
review: Got this from a giveaway and wasn't sure what to expect, but came out (1 hour later) surprised. It's a fun platformer with unique controls, and has HEAVY inspiration from Super Mario 64. Which in my opinion isn't a bad thing. $6 is a steal for this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067700333', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1518291451}
review: Fun Super Mario 64 inspired game. Worlds feel a little empty, but i did keep finding myself wanting to playmore. Haven't played tons yet but I can see myself coming back to this

author: {'steamid': '76561197980924444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1514167680}
review:
This game is fantastic, I've been playing it for hours and it keeps me coming back.  The levels are interesting and challenging, the movement is very intuitive and I've never felt motion sickness once.  The music is also top notch.
Unlocking new abilities is great, can't wait to keep playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978406355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1502157608}
review: Impressions after my first hour: I'm loving it. Imagine if, in the game Super Mario World 64, Mario drove a cartoon hovertank with jumpjets. That's this game, but in VR!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025804303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1499814748}
review:
This game is interesting as a concept, but not really fun to play. The fact that even most people who enjoyed enough to review the game positively have 12 minutes or less playtime shows this. They've tried once and never played again.

You move around in a hovercart, which is fairly awkward to control at times but you need to jump between platforms with it. The weapon is also quite awkward to aim.

Basically you then just go around the level looking for gems with rare obstacles. The levels seem mostly empty. Some of the platforming is fun, but most is pretty boring.

A positive is that you can unlock new abilities as you progress. After 5 gems there's a shield upgrade.

As you can see in the comments, the developer wasn't happy about the negative review with little play time. I then played some more to give it another chance and still felt the same. I notice he hasn't complained about the positive reviews with even less play time. 

He commented on another negative review and they changed to positive. As such it feels difficult to trust this having a high balance of positive to negative.

I did not get any VR sickness, which I've seen some reviewers complain of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099283936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1497638391}

author: {'steamid': '76561198301417309', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1495755839}
review: A vr homage to the platformers of old. I played utilizing the standing settings and had no problems with motion sickness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137796017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1493840986}
review:
This is a really fun game that I think people are missing out on due to not having fancy graphics.
Firstly, the sheer amount of content you're getting is great for VR. Secondly, the controls and ship mechanics are *solid*. Third, the comfort options are awesome. The biggest issue in VR right now is shallow/poorly programmed games, and I would say that Gem Hunter is an example of a well programmed game with lots of passion and nostalgia for Super Mario 64 behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020135537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1491361187}
review:
The game appears well constructed. The visual assets are a bit clunky, but overall nicely done. Signs are relatively easy to read, the controls are easy to learn, and the audio is cute. Play is a little bit simplistic but I admit I wasn't able to get deeper than beyond the tutorial and finding the first yellow diamond due to VR sickness.

If you don't get VR sickness, you might like this one. It brings back fond memories of StarFox and I really liked the level exploration concepts. If you do get VR sickness, Gem Hunter may set you off in under 3 seconds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298025584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1490770622}
review:
《宝石猎人(Gem Hunter)》是一款飞行射击游戏。玩家在游戏中驾驶气垫飞船，击败邪恶的伐女巫，找回狐狸国王丢失的宝石。
　　游戏的画面设计是进来很普遍的低面设计，低多边形的建模和鲜明的色彩搭配，让游戏整体画风看起来比较卡通化，感觉是个颇具童心的童话世界。
　　然而游戏操作却没那么简单，玩家的左手需要操控飞船的上升、转向、前进，右手则是控制飞船前端的大炮射击。主要是飞行移动操作比较麻烦，并且在操作过程中，画面的移动让玩家很容易产生晕眩感，游戏时间越长感觉越明显。
　　目前《宝石猎人》在steam上的售价为31元。游戏玩法比较有趣，但因为操作而导致的晕眩感会比较强，并不适合所有玩家体验，建议感兴趣且不容易晕的玩家购买体验。
http://www.83830.com/game/201703/180045044.shtml
